meanings.definition: (verb) To move in a quick, irregular manner
meanings.sent1: The leaves popple in the wind.
meanings.sent2: I watched the water popple over the rocks.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel made the acorns popple as it scurried up the tree.
meanings.sent4: Her heart began to popple with excitement as she approached the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The flames seemed to popple and dance in the fireplace.

meanings.definition: (noun) A slight, quick movement or sound
meanings.sent1: I heard a popple in the bushes.
meanings.sent2: The popple of the leaves underfoot was soothing.
meanings.sent3: The popple of the popcorn in the microwave signaled movie night.
meanings.sent4: The popple of the stream could be heard from afar.
meanings.sent5: The popple of the flag in the breeze was a comforting sound.
